choices.text: Dribbling decreased in case of urethral stricture
Collection of urine in 'U' shaped curve of bulb of penis

questions.text: Postmicturition dribbling is due to: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Post micturition dribbling of urine occurs because of urine which is collected in the U shaped curve of the bulb of penis.

choices.text: Colour duplex ultrasonography of the scrotum

questions.text: Semen analysis of a young man who presented with primary infertility revealed low volume, fructose negative ejaculate with azoospermia. Which of the following is the most useful imaging modality to evaluate the cause of this infertility? (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) This case scenario indicates that the site of obstruction is at ejaculatory duct as the patient has no sperms and no fructose in the ejaculate. High Frequency transrectal ultrasound (TRUS) offers superb imaging of the prostate, seminal vesicles, and ejaculatory ducts. Due to both accuracy and convenience, TRUS has replaced surgical vasography in the diagnosis of obstructive lesions that cause infertility. Option A that is colour Doppler USG of scrotum is done when one suspects the cause of infertility as varicocele.

questions.text: Absence of fructose in semen indicates: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Absence of fructose in the semen indicates seminal vesicle agenesis or obstruction of its duct or the ejaculatory duct. Option C that is obstruction at vas deferens presents as azoospermia and not as absence of fructose in the semen. Option D that is testicular failure will also present as azoospermia and will have fructose in the secretion .

choices.text: Anterior urethra is the most likely site of injury
Retrograde urethrography should be done after the patient is stabilized
Foley catheter may be carefully passed if the RCU is normal
Rectal examination may reveal a large pelvis

questions.text: A 25 years old male presents to emergency department following a road traffic accident. On examination there is pelvic fracture and blood at urethral meatus. Following are true about patient except: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Posterior urethral injury is associated with pelvic fracture, and not the anterior urethral injury. Option B is correct as RGU is the first step which needs to be done when patient is stabilised so that we come to know whether there is any injury to the urethra or not. Option C Is correct if the RGU is normal all we need to do is pass a catheter and keep it insitu for 1-2 weeks. Option D is correct as sometimes along with this injury we get high riding prostate gland and therefore on per rectal examination we get large pelvis.

choices.text: Can be associated with fracture pelvis
Bladder injury is associated with posterior urethral injuries
Blood at the external urethral meatus is an important feature

questions.text: Not true about urethral injuries is: (AIIMS Nov 2015)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A is the answer as whenever a patient has a suspected urethral injury we never attempt catheterization. We do a RGU to look for any urethral injury and if there is no urethral injury we go for catheterization and if RGU detects the injury we need to go for urinary diversion in the form of SPC. Option B is correct as posterior urethral injuries are associated with pelvic fracture in many cases . Option C is correct as extra peritoneal bladder injury is associated with posterior urethral injury in many cases. Option D is correct as whenever a patient of trauma has blood at external urethral meatus, we suspect urethral injury in these patients.

questions.text: Membranous urethral rupture causes collection of blood in (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Membranous uretha injury denotes posterior urethal injury in this we get extravasation of blood in deep perineal pouch leading to perineal hematoma. With injury to the penile urethra, we have extravasation of blood in the pelvic region leading to pelvic hematoma.

questions.text: Catheterization should not be done in case of acute retention of urine due to: (PGI Nov 2015)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) We do not do catheterization following retention of urine in post trauma and diagnosed cases of urethral injury as the act of catheterization usually worsens the degree of urethral injury. In all the other options mentioned above ,we do carry out catheterization.

questions.text: In case of pelvic fracture with urethral injury the most important first step in management is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Whenever a patient of pelvic fracture comes to you there is a high chance that he will be in a state of shock so first you have to apply a pelvic binder to the patient to facilitate a tamponade effect then we need to correct the shock and hemorrhage. After this we have to fix the bony pelvis and evaluate for the urethral injury by doing RGU and further management depends on the results of RGU.

questions.text: Commonest late complication of traumatic rupture of urethra is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Commonest late complication of traumatic rupture of urethra is urethral stricture. Option A that is diverticulum is caused by any pathology which increases intra vesical pressure. Retrograde ejaculation occurs after the TURP . Chordee is a feature of hypospadias .

questions.text: Rupture of membranous urethra occurs more commonly due to: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Rupture of membranous urethra occurs more commonly due to fixity of urethra as this part of urethra is fixed to urogenital diaphragm any shearing force applied to this part causes avulsion of the membranous urethra leading to urethral injury so injury to membranous urethra occurs more commonly due to fixity of urethra.

questions.text: A 32-year-old man with pelvic fracture is in urinary retention with blood at the external urinary meatus; Retrograde urethrogram shows prostatomembranous urethra disruption. The most appropriate immediate treatment is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Immediate treatment required in this case is supra pubic catheterization to make a proper channel for urinary outflow. Option A is not the answer as urethral catheterization is not done for urethral disruption. Option B that is exploration and repair is done for urethral stricture and not in case of acute urethral disruption.

choices.text: Road-traffic accident with fracture pelvis and rupture urethra

questions.text: The commonest cause of an obliterative stricture of the membranous urethra is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Road traffic accident with fracture of the pelvis is associated with posterior urethral injury, mostly membranous urethral injury. Over a long period of time that is over 4-6 weeks these injuries can convert into urethral strictures by the process of healing and fibrosis. Option A that is fall-astride injury is associated with anterior urethral injury.

questions.text: The following are complications of stricture urethra except: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) There is no relation between stricture urethra and papilloma of bladder. Option A that is periurethral abscess can occur as a complication of urethral stricture. Option B that is inguinal hernia can also occur because of urethral stricture as it causes a constant obstruction to the outflow of urine and in order to overcome this obstruction the patient applies more pressure. Option C that is hydronephrosis can occur because of back pressure changes due to urethral stricture.

questions.text: Commonest cause of urethral stricture in a young person is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Commonest cause of urethral stricture is trauma that is iatrogenic. Gonococcal infection, syphilis and tuberculosis can also be a cause of urethral stricture but they are not the most common causes.

questions.text: Optical urethroplasty is done in: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) optical urethrotomy is done for urethral stricture . It is also called as VIU that is visual internal urethrotomy. Optical urethrotomy has nothing to do with hypospadias, epispadias and testicular tumours.

questions.text: On exertion, urine stream is increased in: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) on exertion urinary stream increases in urethral stricture as you have an obstruction in the passage of urine which is overcome by the pressure which builds up behind the stricture area. Option A that is prostatic enlargement and option B that is Marion’s disease which is the other name of bladder outlet obstruction ,the stream of urine decreases with increase in the force.

questions.text: Palpable fibrous plaque on dorsal penile shaft indicates:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Peyronie’s disease is a condition in which there is fibrous plaque deposition in the tunica albugenia surrounding the penis . This leads to the dorsal bending curvature in the penis and is called as peyronie’s disease. Paget’s disease is a disease involving bones and is a metabolic disease of bone. Potter’s syndrome is a condition which occurs when there is severe oligohydramnios in intrauterine life and infant develops severe pulmonary hypoplasia. Phren’s sign is used to distinguish between epididymo-orchitis and testicular torsion and is not related to plaque deposition in penile shaft.

choices.text: Patient presents with complaints of painful erection
The condition can be associated with Dupuytren contracture of the tendon of the hand
Spontaneous regression occurs in 50% of the cases

questions.text: The following statements are true about Peyronie's disease except: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Peyronie’s disease is a condition where fibrous plaque is deposited in tunica albugenia around the penis. It leads to a curvature in the penile shaft leading to painful erection of penis. Condition ocuurs in males who are 30-40 years of age and is associated with dupuytren’s contracture and reidel’s thyroiditis. Most of the patients, around 50 % have spontaneous resolution of the disease and others require nesbit’s procedure.

questions.text: All are true about Peyronie's disease except: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option B is wrong as medical treatment is not effective for peyronie’s disease. Option A is right as 50 % of patients suffering from peyronie’s disease show spontaneous regression. Option C is correct as it is associated with dupuytren’s contracture. Option D is correct as in peyronie’s disease we have a fibrous plaque with calcified plaque deposition.

questions.text: Peyronie's disease affects: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Peyronie’s disease is a condition where fibrous plaque is deposited in tunica albugenia around the penis. Peyronie’s disease is not associated with prostate, urinary bladder and kidney.

choices.text: Curved deformity of penis due to fibrous plaque

questions.text: Peyronie's disease is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Peyronie’s disease is a condition where fibrous plaque is deposited in tunica albugenia around the penis Option A is wrong as in peyronie’s disease there is no browning of the penis in particular. Option B is wrong as in peyronie’s disease we do not have ectopic location of urethral meatus. Urethral meatal opening is at normal location.

questions.text: Nesbitt's operation is done for: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Nesbitt’s operation is a procedure done for correcting the curvature of penis in peyronie’s disease. For ectopic testis we do orchidopexy

questions.text: The recommended treatment for preputial adhesions producing ballooning of prepuce during micturition in a 2 years old boy is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) As this patient is 2 year old and only has ballooning of penis without any complications like hydronephrosis we do not need to carry out circumcision until 16 years of age. Circumcision is done if patient has some complication like hydronephrosis, or has reached 16 years of age and has not responded to conservative treatment options like steroidal cream application. Dorsal slit procedure is done for paraphimosis .

questions.text: Not true about paraphimosis is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) there is no relation between paraphimosis and diabetes mellitus. Option A is correct as paraphimosis is never congenital, it is always acquired and most of the times iatrogenic. Option C is also correct as if paraphimosis is left untreated in advanced cases it can lead to gangrene of the penile shaft. Option D is correct as circumcision is the ultimate treatment of paraphimosis.

questions.text: Indications of circumcision are all except: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Carcinoma penis is not an indication of circumcision. In Ca Penis we need to go for partial or total penectomy. Chronic balanoposthetitis, Jew religion and paraphimosis are the indications of circumcision.

questions.text: Persistent priapism is rarely seen as a consequence of: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Prolonged sexual activity is never a cause of persistant priapism. Sickle cell anaemia and leukemia are the cause of ischemic priapism and spinal cord disease is a cause of non ischemic priapism.

questions.text: In children persistent priapism may result due to: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Priapism is of two types ischemic and non ischemic. Ischemic priapism is the one which comes as a surgical emergency and is more common in children. In children it can occur because of underlying sickle cell disease or leukemia. Leukemia is the most common cause of ischemic priapism in children.

choices.text: Locally aggressive form of condyloma acuminata
Wide excision is the treatment of choice

questions.text: True about verrucous carcinoma is all except (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Verrucous carcinoma are also known as Buschke Lowenstein tumour and this a premalignant lesion of penile carcinoma which is locally aggressive. It never undergoes metastasis and is treated with wide local excision.

questions.text: Buschke-Lowenstein tumor is: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Verrucous carcinoma are also known as Buschke Lowenstein tumour and this a premalignant lesion of penile carcinoma which is locally aggressive. It never undergoes metastasis and is treated with wide local excision. Option A is a whitish plaque which develops in the penile shaft and is a premalignant condition of ca penis. Option B is a skin lesion which is a nodular lesion with central umbilication. Option D is false as verrucous carcinoma is not a benign lesion, it is actually a premalignant lesion of carcinoma penis.

questions.text: In CA penis, soft tissue planes are best delineated by:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) MRI is the best investigation to delineate soft tissue planes and depth of invasion into soft tissue by the tumour. CT scan , X-ray and USG can not give the soft tissue planes dilneation in a proper way.

questions.text: The most common cause of death in carcinoma penis:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Most common cause of death in carcinoma penis is erosion of femoral vessels by the metastatic inguinal lymph nodes. Uremia, urinary sepsis and lung metastasis can occur but the most common cause of death is exanguination due to erosion of the femoral vessels.

choices.text: Sentinel LN biopsy in penile carcinoma

questions.text: Cabana Procedure is done in: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Cabana procedure is a sentinel lymph node biopsy procedure done for penile cancer. It is called cabana procedure as it was first found out by cabana. The first draining lymph node of ca penis is cabana node. RPLND is done in some cases of testicular cancer but cabana procedure is not related to testicular cancer or RPLND.

questions.text: Circumcision is included in management of CA penis at: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Circumcision is the treatment used for the treatment of ca penis which is limited to prepuceal skin. If Ca penis involves glans and glanuloprepuceal sulcus we need to do a partial penectomy in these patients. If Ca penis involves proximal shaft we have to subject the patient for complete penectomy

choices.text: Circumcision soon after birth provides total immunity

questions.text: Features of carcinoma penis are all except: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) most common histological type of carcinoma penis is squamous cell carcinoma. Option A is correct as circumcision soon after birth provides total immunity against penile cancer. In penile cancer, there is a frequent metastasis to inguinal lymph nodes and it leads to erosion of underlying femoral artery which is the most common cause of death in carcinoma penis. Treatment of choice for Ca penis is surgery.

choices.text: Due to failure of fusion of posterior wall of urethra

questions.text: True about hypospadias: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Hypospadias is associated with ventral chordee and dorsal hooded prepuce. Hypospadias is not associated with undescended testis, epispadias is associated with undescended testis. Hypospadias is caused due to defect in the fusion of urethral fold which fuses from behind to forward. Circumcision is contraindicated in patients who suffer from hypospadias as this skin is used to make a tubular structure during the repair of hypospadias.

questions.text: True about hypospadias is all except (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Hypospadias is the most common congenital anomaly of the male urethra and occurs with the incidence of 1 in 250 births. Option A is correct as in patients of hypospadias sometimes we can not determine the sex of the child in severe cases. Option B is correct as in patients of hypospadias we have a ventral chordee with hooded prepuce. Option D is true because if the patient has a very mild form of glanular hypospadias there is no significant functional abnormality and such patients do not need any form of treatment.

questions.text: Most common congenital anomaly of urethra: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Hypospadias is the most common congenital anomaly of male urethra and incidence of hypospadias is 1 in 250 live births.

questions.text: Commonest hypospadias is (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Distal hypospadias is more common as compared to proximal hypospadias, so the most common type of hypospadias is glanular type. Hypospadias can be classified according to the anatomical location of the urethral meatus. Anterior (or distal):- glandular, coronal, and subcoronal (~50%). Middle:- distal penile, midshaft, and proximal penile (~30%). Posterior (or proximal):-penoscrotal, scrotal and perineal (~20%).

choices.text: No treatment required in glandular variety

questions.text: All are true about hypospadias, except (AIIMS Nov 2015)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option B is wrong as the ideal age for surgery in a case of hypospadias is 9 to 10 months. Option A is correct as circumcision is contraindicated in patients of hypospadias as this prepuceal skin is used in later stages for construction the remaining part of urethra. Option C is correct as there is no functional defect in glanular variety and so we do not need to operate in such patients. Option D is correct as in patients of hypospadias we have ventral chordee and hooded prepuce.

questions.text: Penis is curved in downward direction in all types of hypospadias except
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Most common type of hypospadias is the distal type. Most severe type of hypospadias is proximal type. As Glanular type is least severe form of hypospadias we see minimal or no curvature in glanular variety.

questions.text: In severe hypospadias ,the possibility of an intersex problem is settled by
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) In severe hypospadias, sometimes it is difficult to comment on the sex of the child by looking at the external genitalia of the patient. In such cases we make a confirmative diagnosis of the sex of the featus by karyotyping. Option B is wrong as biopsy of the gonadal tissue is a tedious process and undesirable and can lead to break in blood testis barrier of the patient. Option D is not used to determine the sex of the patient.

questions.text: Epispadias is associated with: (LQ)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Epispadias is associated with dorsal chordee and ventral curvature of penis . Option B is wrong as epispadias is not associated with bifid pubic symphysis, infact epispadias is associated with widely separated pubic bones, bifid clittoris, ectopic vesicae, undescended testis and cryptorchidism. Option C and Option D are not associated with epispadias.

choices.text: Can be detected by prenatal USG

questions.text: All are true about posterior urethral valve except:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) in patients of posterior urethral valve, urethroscopy finding is normal at least in early cases. Option A is correct as posterior urethral valve is an exclusive diagnosis of males. In other words it occurs only in boys. Option B is correct as posterior urethral valve can be diagnosed on prenatal USG and it shows a key hole sign. Option C is correct as in patients of posterior urethral valve we should do early catheterization before there occurs any rise in the creatinine levels and prevent the formation of overdistention of bladder and urinary ascites.

questions.text: A male child with recurrent UTI with dribbling of urine most likely cause is: (AIIMS May 2015)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Posterior urethral valve causes over distention of bladder with urine stagnation which leads to UTI and due to over distention there occurs a an overflow dribbling in some cases. Option A is wrong as patient of VUR can present with UTI but it will not present with dribbling of urine . Option C is wrong as urethral stricture is extremely uncommon in children and can lead to urinary retention if severe.

questions.text: For posterior urethral valve- investigation of choice is: (AIIMS Nov 2014)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Investigation of choice of posterior urethral valve is MCUG (Micturating cysto urethrogram) . In MCUG we look for the characteristic of the posterior urethra, if the patient has posterior urethral valve we will see dilated posterior urethra with abrupt distal narrowing.

questions.text: Posterior urethral valve are commonly observed in: (AIIMS May 2014)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) In Posterior urethral valve there is occurance of a bilateral symmetric fold of urothelium from verumontenum or just distal to verumontenum till external urethral sphincter. Posterior urethral valve is a disease which occurs only in males. As it is a congenital problem most of the patients present soon after birth and this is the reason why posterior urethal valve is the disease of young boys and not adult males.

questions.text: Most common location of posterior urethral valve:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) In posterior urethral valve there is occurance of a bilateral symmetric fold of urothelium from verumontenum or just distal to verumontenum till external urethral sphincter.
